Description: East Greek terracotta figure vase (plastic vase). Aryballos in the form of a dove; tail, beak and rim damaged. Surface is burnt on the back and traces of white residue on front. From two-piece mould. Orange-brown clay fabric with abundant fine silver mica inclusions.
Curator's comments: Unprovenanced parallel at the British Museum dated late 6th century BC (BM1951,0703.31.2) is of the same fabric. Other parallels from Thera (Maximova 1927: 95 fig.9:1), Lindos, Ialysus and Bassae are sited by Higgins (1954:59). Thought originally to be from Rhodes, though fabric is more similar to that found at Miletus. Parallel from Kamiros (Jacopi 1929, fig. 106). Jacopi, G. 1929. Esplorazione archeologica di Camiro I. Clara Rhodos III. Maximova, M. I. 1927. ‘Les vases plastiques dans l’antiquité’. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (100)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.022) (Phase 3)
Condition: Chipped beack, tail and rim. Burnt surfaces
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committee of)
